intro: Pluchea domingensis, commonly known as the Mexican groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
